result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan T Szydel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**7 days credit if probation revoked.**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: AODA and follow through with recommendations.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan T Szydel

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire/Wavier of Rights with Attachments
Reminder Notice indicating amount due not mailed to defendant with DNA form as defendant's address listed as 'Homeless'.

(10:15 AM case called.) Defendant Ryan T Szydel in court, in custody. Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Ryan T Szydel. Prosecuting Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine without Repeater.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest plea and finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1 without Repeater.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 30 months with the following conditions:
90 days jail with Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. Any contraband seized is ordered destroyed. 7 days credit if probation revoked. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
